alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 1:18PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong rain showers will impact portions of northwestern Washington County through 200 PM EST... At 116 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy showers along the cold front extending from near Vanceboro to near Lakeville. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vanceboro, Princeton, Topsfield, Grand Lake Stream, Dyer Township, Fowler Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, Waite, Codyville, Lambert Lake, Dyer, Big Lake, Fowler and Forest. This includes US Highway 1 between Princeton and Topsfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Northern Washington
